target.description: Display status of OFBiz

target.name: load-demo
target.description: Load all data; meant for generic OFBiz development, testing, demonstration, etc purposes

target.name: load-demo-multitenant
target.description: Load all data needed for the multi-tenancy demonstration. Caution: this creates three databases, with each one loaded with all demo data.

target.name: load-seed
target.description: Load ONLY the seed data (not seed-initial, demo, ext* or anything else); meant for use after an update of the code to reload the seed data as it is generally maintained along with the code and needs to be in sync for operation

target.name: load-extseed
target.description: Load seed, seed-initial and ext data; meant for manual/generic testing, development, or going into production with a derived system based on stock OFBiz where the ext data basically replaces the demo data

target.name: load-exttest
target.description: Load seed, seed-initial, ext and ext-test data; meant for automated testing with a derived system based on stock OFBiz

target.name: load-readers
target.description: Load data using the command line argument data-readers that takes a comma separated list of readers (seed, seed-initial, demo, ext, ext-test, ext-demo). On Windows XP (at least) you need top wrap the parameters in double-quotes. For instance: ant load-readers "-Ddata-readers=seed,seed-initial,ext"

target.name: load-file
target.description: Load data using the command line argument 'data-file' to load data from a given file using the 'default' delegator or a delegator specified in the command line argument 'delegator'

target.name: load-tenant
target.description: Load data using tenantId, syntax eg: ant load-tenant -DtenantId=DEMO1 (needs multitenant=Y in general.properties)

target.name: load-all-tenants
target.description: Load data for all tenants, syntax eg: ant load-all-tenants (needs multitenant=Y in general.properties)

target.name: create-tenant
target.description: Create a new tenant in your environment, create the delegator, load initial data with admin-user and password (needs multitenant=Y in general.properties)
